subject: Hockey, Ice
Basketball
Airlines and Airplanes
lead_paragraph: The United States and Canada have a tentative deal to settle a dispute over charter flights that threatened to disrupt the N.H.L. and N.B.A. seasons, Prime Minister Stephen Harper of Canada said. The United States has insisted that Air Canada cancel all of its season-long sports charters, saying they violate United States law because they operate within the United States rather than between two countries. The N.H.L. regular season begins Oct. 1, the N.B.A. season Oct. 27.
